title: How to Make Banana Ginger Parkin (Vegan)

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 325ºF.
steps.description: Grease and line the cake pan.

steps.headline: Sift together the flour, baking soda and ground ginger in a mixing bowl, then stir in the oats.
Melt the sugar, vegan butter and syrup in a pan over a low heat.
steps.description: Stir mixture until well blended, then stir into the flour mixture. Beat in the mashed bananas.

steps.headline: Spoon the mixture into the pan and bake for about an hour, or until toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean.
steps.description: Leave the parkin to cool in the tin, then turn it out onto a plate or clean work surface and cut into squares.

steps.headline: Dust with confectioner's sugar.
steps.description: This is also known as powdered sugar or caster sugar. This is optional if desired.

text: Preheat the oven to 325ºF. Grease and line the cake pan. Sift together the flour, baking soda and ground ginger in a mixing bowl, then stir in the oats.  Melt the sugar, vegan butter and syrup in a pan over a low heat. Stir mixture until well blended, then stir into the flour mixture. Beat in the mashed bananas. Spoon the mixture into the pan and bake for about an hour, or until toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean. Leave the parkin to cool in the tin, then turn it out onto a plate or clean work surface and cut into squares. Dust with confectioner's sugar. This is also known as powdered sugar or caster sugar. This is optional if desired. Serve. Add vegan whipped cream (optional).
